:::{#thm-d_pi-d_eta}

$$\derivf{\prob}{\logodds} = \pi (1-\pi)$$
:::

---

::: proof

By the chain rule (@thm-chain-rule), @cor-d_omega-d_eta, and @thm-deriv-invodds:

$$
\ba
\derivf{\prob}{\logodds} 
&= \green{\derivf{\odds}{\logodds}}\blue{\derivf{\prob}{\odds}}
\\
&= \green{\frac{\pi}{1-\pi}} \blue{(1-\pi)^2}
\\
&= \pi (1-\pi)
\ea
$$

Alternatively, by @thm-deriv-logit:

$$
\ba
\derivf{\prob}{\logodds} 
&= \invf{\derivf{\logodds}{\prob}}
\\
&= \invf{\frac{1}{(\prob)(1-\prob)}}
\\
&= \pi (1-\pi)
\ea
$$

:::

---

:::{#cor-d_pi-d_eta-var}

If $\pi = \Pr(Y=1| \vX=\vx)$, then:

$$\derivf{\pi}{\eta} = \Varf{Y|X=x}$$
:::
